sense.def: Alternative Names yan xie 眼斜.

a) eyes being slanted to one side. Qian jin bei ji fang 千金備急方 13: 治頭風眩，口喎目斜耳聾，大 三五七散方 , “To cure head wind with dizziness, wryness of the mouth, slanting of an eye , and deafness, [use the] recipe for ‘the massive powder with [dosages of ingredients varying from] three to five and to seven [ qian ]’”.
b) Eyes squinting. Yi xue zheng chuan 醫學正傳 6: 口噤目斜，身體強直，如角弓反張之狀 , “Lockjaw, squinting , and a stiff and straight body, resembling arched reverse strain”. Mu xuan 目眩 , visual dizziness [29]
Alternative Writing yan xuan 眼眩.

Illness Sign of dim vision, with darkness in front of the eyes. Su wen 素問 40: 四肢清，目眩，時 時前後血，病名為何 , “Their four limbs are cool. Their eyes are dizzy . They often pass blood in front and behind. What is the name of [this] disease?”
